execution_quality: The agent made targeted edits to address individual requests, but failed to recognize the shared system architecture mentioned in the initial request context, resulting in work that addressed only one of multiple views that needed consistent changes.
work_category: UI implementation work focused on shopping list display and interaction patterns. The agent modified item visibility, interaction handlers, and button labels in the shopping screen component.
summary: The agent executed edits competently but fundamentally misunderstood the task scope. While the initial request appeared to be shopping-screen-specific, the system architecture requires changes across multiple views for consistency. The user's follow-up clarification reveals the agent worked on only one component of a multi-view system, necessitating substantial rework to implement changes consistently across all tabs.
follow_up_pattern: User immediately points out that the work was incomplete—the agent needed to apply changes across multiple tabs (shopping, pantry/storage) as part of a unified tree editing system, not just the shopping screen alone.
